inn1.comm: Typical Pollock. On target right away. full and on the off and middle stump line, defended on the front foot.
Switches to his favourite channel - outside off, left alone
And again. This one comes back in a touch but still in that zone. Left alone again.
he doesn't get tired at all. Again in the same zone, another leave from the batsman
changes the line, homes in on the middle stump line, worked away to midwicket
completes a maiden with a delivery whizzing past off stump. Watts lets it go through. He seems to know where his off stump is, has not fished at anything.
on the pad, dabbed to the on side
beaten. The Ntini angle. Lands around leg and middle stump and seams away past the off stump.
Quick and risky single. Haq pushed a length-delivery  towards Langeveldt at mid-off and set off. Direct hit but he just made it. Only just.
full and outside off and Watts does what he does best - shouldering arms
beaten. Ntini teases the outside edge with a delivery that straightened after landing just outside off and this time Watts is sucked into a poke.
Ah! back to regular progamming. Just outside off, Watts is a conservative man, doesn't flirt around and Boucher gathers.
Haq is harassed by Pollock.  In the corridor outside off and Haq tries to guide it to point
puts bat to ball and steers a length-delivery, on the off stump line (where else from Pollock?!) to point
There we go. Another one kissing past the outside edge. Haq is no Watts, he likes to fish and flirt.
in the zone outside off, dabbed to third man
Watts looks pretty compact player. Leans into the line, works a fullish delivery past square-leg
half-volley outside off stump, Watts moves quickly towards the line, stretches forward and square-drives it through cover point
leans forward, pushes a length-delivery around off stump line, towards point
angling in from outside off, at the body, nudged to square-leg

from wide of the crease, coming in towards off stump, Watts plays it with soft hands, too soft and gets a inside-edge to fine leg. He was dismissed by McGrath in the previous game in a similar fashion. Trying to play late and with soft hands and ended up chopping it on to the off stump
Haq has a open-stance. Moves towards the length-delivery on the middle stump line, pushes it out to cover
full and straight. Ntini does it occasionally. He will straighten the delivery now and then. Haq stabs at it and the ball rolls in front of him
Watts has a near-fatal poke. Again full and straight around off stump that moves away a touch.
tries to get this one in and ends up drifting towards pads, tucked past square-leg for a single
leans forward to defend
full in length, on the middle and leg, straightens a touch, Haq stretches forward, head over the ball and defends.
Overpitched outside off stump, Haq jumps at the width, drives but straight to cover. Missed opportunity there.
back of length, just outside off stump, punched on the up to cover point where de Villiers moves to his left to make a neat stop
streaky edge to third man boundary. Short in length and outside off, Watts frees his arms and will get a boundary.
lands outside off, angles in, pushed back to the bowler
hits the deck short of length, outside off stump, comes in a touch, Watts moves across, pushes it out to cover point
Full and outside off, left alone
fullish, on the off and middle stump line, defended to cover
in the zone outside off stump, dabbed to cover
short of length, outside off stump, nudged past backward point
Back of a length drifting onto the pads, Watts flicks it square
Full length ball. 80.9mph and making the batsman play. Watts pushes firmly to the off side. Good probing line from Pollock
Slightly outside off and tapped away to the point fielder. Pollock maintaining a good length and just varying the line subtly. Typical Pollock
Straight and probing. Driven back to the bowler. Fine over. Giving nothing away
Snorter! Short and steepling bounce. Pitches halfway through the pitch and rises clsoe to Haq's shoulder. Moving away also. Quite unplayable that
Back of a length, touched to the midwicket fielder
SImilar delivery but Haq gets is slightly wide of mid-on this time. Batsmen scamper through a quick single
Again slightly short of a length and straight. Watts struck on the pads but it's a bit too high. Appeal goes up but Ntini quickly restrains himself

OH! Almost a run-out. Watts steers behind point and takes off but Haq refuses the single. Gibbs quickly moves across from point and sniffs a big run-out chance. Takes his time, takes aim and lets rip but the ball just misses the stumps. Direct hit and Watts had no chance. Just survives
Driven back to the bowler
Slightly wide of off and jabbed to the off side. Pollock probing, Haq keeping it out
SHOT! Full length ball outside off and Haq eases into it with an efficient movement. Crisply timed and driven between cover and extra cover for a cracking four. Doesn't get moe confident than that
Tapped to point
Banged in short, well-directed bouncer as well. Haq sways out of the way well, though. He's handled the short stuff well so far.

CRACK! Another four. Slightly shot again and Haq stands back and swivels it behind square. It was a short-arm jab and raced away to the fence. Assertive start this from Scotland. Stark contrast to their batting against Australia
driven to cover. No run but it's a good over for Scotland. Eight off it
Tucked square. It was drifting down leg and he kept it away
Defended to the off side. Nice pace from Ntini. Touching 140 kph
SENSATIONAL PULL SHOT! Short ball from Ntini, screaming at 80mph and pulled away off the front foot. That gets the meat of the bat and soars way over midwicket for a huge six. Audacious that! U LA LA
Majestic straight drive to a fuller one, well-timed but Charl Langeveldt, at mid-off, dives to keep them to a single
Back-foot defend, a tap almost.
Cut to cover but no run there. Good going from the Scots
Watts continues to look pretty solid out there. He moves in line, turns a length-delivery, to midwicket for a single
short of length, outside off stump, guided to point
Haq moves almost lazily forward. The left-handers give out that impression. Some of them at least. leans forward, dabs a fullish delivery to the off side
full, straight on the middle and leg, Haq waits for the ball to come, wrists it towards square-leg, and they will get a overthrow as Kemp fails to back up
full, hint of away movement, outside off, steered to third man
on the middle and leg stump line, from a length, nudged to square-leg
on the hips, tries to tuck it away, gets a leg bye to fine leg

Andrew Hall gets the breakthrough. Majid Haq falls to a fatal poke outside off stump. Full in length, angling away, Haq opens the bat-face, tries to run it down to third man and nicks it behind. Scotland lose their first wicket.
on the middle stump line, defended on the front foot
shapes in towards the pads, dabbed away to the on side
skidder , on the off and middle stump line, pushed down the track
appeal for lbw as the ball veers in from the middle stump line, and thuds into the pad. It was high, was going down leg side and apart from it, t'was a good shout!
Pollock continues. This is his 7th over. Now and then, Watts pushes at a delivery outside off and gets beaten. Usually, he is pretty sure of his off stump, doesn't have a waft.
fuller, around off, square-driven past point
full and straight, on the middle stump line, leans forward, taps it close on the leg side. No chance of a run.
on the off stump line, cuts in a touch, Watts leans forward, opens the bat-face, steers it to backward point region and will get a single
Rushes through the channel outside off, left alone
fullish, on the off stump line, pushed to point
on the off stump line, Watts pushes it to cover region.

And again Watts runs into that problem. At times he plays it late, too late and with soft hands and the ball skids towards the stumps after the impact. Again, this time, he didn't know where it went, looked all round and got a eureka moment when he saw the ball sitting behind him. As they say, the truth is always under your nose.
length-delivery outside off stump, guided to third man
length-delivery, around off stump, pushed to cover point
Watson charges down the track, reaches the pitch and smokes it through the cover. Audacious hit.
Watts falls after a stiff resistance. He looks pretty shattered. Has an uncharacteristic flash at a length-delivery outside off, gets an edge and is swallowed at first slip.
greeted by an bouncer . Good idea but can we get it on target please?! This one sails down the leg side and Hamilton has a big smile spread across his face
on target, around off and middle, pushed to cover
leans forward, turns a length-delivery to point
pitches on a good length, around middle and off stump, slides away but Hamilton has it covered. Leans forward, covers the movement and defends
gets this one down to third man.
fullish, outside off, Watson tries to drive it through the off side, the bat-face shuts and he gets an inside-edge and the ball rolls over to the off side.
Eases forward, gets behind the line of a delivery around off stump, pushes it out to cover region
on the leg and middle, full in length, Hamilton wrist it away to square-leg
in the zone outside off stump, again skids on to the bat , steered to third man
short in length, outside off stump, Watson shifts his weight back, punches it past point.
dug in short, Watson shapes to pull, but is beaten by the pace, ends up lapping it to the on side. He got out pulling in the game against Australia
Crack. Again banged in short but Watson is ready this time, swivels nicely and pulls past square-leg
In the zone outside off stump, left alone
on the leg and middle stump line, turned down to fine leg
Another charge by Watson. Langeveldt follows him with a delivery at his body,  Watson adjusts and shovels it past midwicket
short in length, just outside off stump, cut to point. Fiercely struck but straigh to the fielder.
almost a mix-up. Dabbed to the on side, and sets off for a run. The fielder rushes in from square-leg and Watson rushes back to his crease and makes it in time.
edge but falls just short of Smith at first slip. Full and skidding away, Hamilton has a flash and nicks it low to the right of Smith.
similar delivery, driven to extra cover
on the middle stump line, full in length, driven to cover
Another Watson charge but can't connect. The ball heads through to Boucher. Beaten by the slower delivery from Hall.
block. Leans forward to defend.
Another slower delivery and Watson can't resist a slash. It balloons down to Pollock at third man but falls short
Fab stroke. Full in length and outside off, Watson punches it through point.
slower one on the off and middle, and Watson blocks.
leans forward, pushes a full-length delivery to cover
sliding on to the pads, Watson has a nibble at it, no luck and it thuds into the pad

Watson has got the suicidal itch. Pushes a length-delivery towards mid-off and sets off. Hamilton is no mood to get anywhere. He stays where he is and Watson turns and head back. There is a direct hit but our man is in.
Hamilton is gone. After pottering around for some time, he suddenly decides to have a go - drives on the up, but sends it straight to cover.
Another Scotland batsman who stands with his bat raised in the air. Leans forward to a length-delivery on the off stump line and pushes it out to the off side
off cutter, moves in from outside off, left alone.
on the middle peg, McCallum taps it away.

cries of catch it but Boucher clangs it. Didn't come off the bat though. Must have gone off the fore arm. The ball pitched outside off and cut back in, McCallum didn't want to play at it, tried to withdraw the bat out of the line and the ball went off the fore arm to Boucher who didn't gather it.
another off cutter, stabs at it, gets a inside-edge to the leg side
tip and run. pushed to the off side and rushes across for a quick single
full, straight, on the off stump line, steered to point
bouncer on the middle stump line, ducks under
fuller, on the off and middle, pushed back down the track. McCallum is still yet to get off the mark.
He will stay there. Another full-length delivery has been patted back.
slides to the leg side, and thuds into the pad.
in the temptation zone outside off, a lame poke and is beaten.  pork is good ... poke should be shelved
bouncer, on the off side and Watson sways away
attempted yorker, slips down leg side. Boucher tries to oldest trick in the world. Goes up in appeal to distract the umpire who shrugs his shoulder and calls it a wide.
on the legs, dabbed away past square-leg
on the off stump line, defended on the front foot.
lands on a length, around middle stump line, veers in and thuds into the pad and runs towards short third man
fullish, skids onto the bat and MacCallum pushes forward in defense
length-delivery on the leg stump line, MacCallum stays adjacent to the line, pushes it out to the off side.
fuller, straighter, driven to mid-on
on the leg and middle, again MacCallum stays adjacent to the line and defends. Still on a duck
Full in length, outside off stump, driven through point
inswinger, on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
on the off stump line, pushed to point
beaten. Rushes through the channel outside off stump, a lazy waft and the ball kisses past the outside edge
bouncer on the off stump line, MacCullum does well to drop his wrists and sways away from the line
Whoa! MacCullum is off the mark. 19th time lucky. Short of length, outside off, cut to deep point.
Full in length, on the middle stump line, defended on the front foot.
Maybe he should not have gotten off the mark. That single gave him too much confidence. He charges down the track and yorks himself.
off the mark immediately. On the hips, clipped away past square-leg
length-delivery that comes in from outside off, pushed back down the track
bumper and swayed away.

on the hips, turned to midwicket and Watson, at non-striker's end, thinks there is a single in it. Not surprising considering he had this illusion a few times already. The throw comes in fast and if it had hit, he would have been a goner.
length-delivery, on the off stump line, guided to third man where Pollock makes a neat sliding stop
length-delivery on the off stump, punched to point
lands on a length, on the off stump line, Brown punches it on the up, to left of de Villiers at cover point who flings himself to his left to make the stop. Acrobatic effort.
slower one, full in length, outside off, driven to wide third man
overpitched and driven but again super stop at cover.

Ntini comes into the attack, fullish and on the stumps straight away, the ball comes in with the arm as Ntini delivers from wide of the crease, Watson moves across nicely and tucks the ball away to the leg side
just short of a driving length and outside the off stump this time, not much movement in the air or off the pitch, played down to point but no chance of a run
once again Ntini is back to the full ball on the stumps, it's clipped to the leg side where Pollock fields and has a shy at the stumps, direct hit but the batsman is well home
once again full and on the pads, worked away to the leg side
full and straight - that seems to be Ntini's area of operation at the moment, defended away to the leg side but it is straight to the fielder and there's no chance of a run
almost an action replay, bunted to the leg side but straight to the fielder
short one banged in by Kallis, awkward pull shot played down to the leg side, not really in control but safe anyhow
once again back of a driving length and once again the batsman is forced to awkwardly push the ball away to the on side
short of a length and outside the off, Dougie Brown pushes the ball just wide of the man at cover and hares off for a single. AB de Villiers fields and throws but misses
fullish and outside the off, eased towards cover
just short of a driving length and slipping down leg, clipped away through square-leg for a single
another one that's just a touch too short and Watson swivels nicely and works the ball down towards deep backward square-leg for a single to end the over
back of a length, pitching outside off, angling in, nothing for the batsman, who is cramped, to do but play the ball away to the on side with an angled bat
good-length ball on the stumps, this time there's a single on offer as the ball is played away to the leg side with soft hands
slipping down the leg side once more, Watson flicks and misses, the ball goes off the pad down leg for a leg-bye
short of a good length and on the stumps, defended back down the pitch with the full face of the bat
very full and on the stumps, speared in from wide of the crease, the batsman thinks about giving himself some room but in the end settles for a defensive prod towards the off side
again very wide of the crease from Ntini, Watson is tucked up but manages to nudge the ball to the leg side
pushed through a touch fuller and on the off, Brown watches the ball carefully - it's a slower ball - and defends with care, the ball bobbles back towards the stumps but misses and goes to the keeper
slightly overpitched and outside the off, Brown goes for the drive this time and misses, the ball sneaks through and goes to the keeper

good-length ball outside the off, Brown pushes to cover and sets off for a single. The fielder is AB de Villers. He gets to the ball early, lines up the stumps and has a go. Bang on target and Ryan Watson, who is running to the danger end, knows there is no chance of him making it back in time. The decision is referred to the third umpire, but there is no real need. Watson is on his way ...
Buzzes through close to the off stump but he lets it go through on the length. And it bounces over.
bouncer and Smith goes down under. Sails harmlessly high above the head.
fuller and a tad outside off, slashed away to third man
floated on the off stump line, pushed out to cover
slower through the air, turns in from outside off and defended on the front foot
tossed up, on the off stump line, driven back to Smith
lands outside off and another forward defense is executed
slightly short in length, outside off, cut to deep point
flat and on the middle and leg stump line, paddled away fine.
full in length, outside off, run down to third man
Full and in the temptation zone, Brown has a flash and is beaten
slower on, breaks in from outside off, driven to cover
faster, in the same zone ,again driven to cover. The chokehold continues.
leans forward, places a length-delivery past point for a single.
slower one, full in length, swatted back to the bowler.
on the middle stump line, worked to midwicket
on the middle stump line, nudged to midwicket
flighted up, not much spin though, driven to long-on
comes down the track and drives to mid-off
on the middle peg, bunted past midwicket for a single. Drinks.
on the middle stump line, full in length, driven to mid-on
off cutter on the off stumo line, punched to mid-on
slightly short in length, pulled away but straight to midwicket
slower one - Kallis is mixing things up, on the off stump line, driven to cover
slightly short in length, on the middle and leg stump line, worked past square-leg for a single.
pushes that one through quicker, on the similar line as the previous one, and stabbed away to the on side
low full toss, on the off and middle, eased down to long-on. No effort to tonk that dolly.
turns in from outside off, attempted sweep shot produces an inside-edge on to the pad
leans forward, drives a fullish delivery to long-off
pushed that through quickly and punched to long on
dragged that one touch short and pulled away to deep square leg region
ooh.... how did that miss the stumps? An ambitious swipe across the line, misses and the ball flies over the stumps.
fuller and he is driven through cover
leans forward to a length-delivery, opens the bat-face, guides it to right of point
slower delivery, breaks in from outside off, pushed out to point
Another slower one. Kallis is bowling heaps of them today. Steered to point. Looks like Pollock is warming up.
full and on the middle stump line, flicked past square-leg
in the channell outside off, defended on the front foot
similar line, slightly closer to the off stump, pushed to cover
Streaky edge through vacant slip region. Smith is at short fine third man and no one in the slips. Smith, the batsman, has a flash at a length-delivery outside off and gets an edge.
Charges down the track, Pollock is not impressed and hurls a bouncer and it flies over the helmet as Smith shapes to pull.
around the off stump line, pushed to cover
slower one, off break action, pushed into cover region
on the off stump line, tapped to right of Gibbs at point
full in length, on the off stump line, again pushed to right of Gibbs but this time Gibbs swoops on to it in a flash
from wide of the crease, full and on the middle stump line, Smith backs away to leg side and whacks it straight to mid-off.
again wide of the crease, again full in length, this time Smith takes the orthodox route. Stays where he is, drives to sweeper cover
similar delivery, slashed away, off the outer part of the bat, down to third man
full in length, on the off and middle stump line, driven to sweeper cover
lands on a length, around off, straightens, guided to point
Polly cleans up Smith. Strangling delivery on the off and middle, Smith ends up playing all around it as he tries to work it across the line.
banged in short, outside off, swayed away
lands on a length, around off stump, comes in a touch, pushed out to the cover region.
Banged in short, rises head-high, Brown shapes to pull but is beaten by the pace.  Well-directed bumper.
fuller, on a length, around middle and off, pushed to mid-on
short of length, outside off, punched through point
leans forward, pushes a full-pitched delivery outside off, to cover.
climbs up from short of length, chest-high, Blain fends it off towards point
from wide of the crease, full and furious on the middle stump line, eased towards mid-on
short in length, pulled in the air, over midwicket.
pitches on a length, on the middle and off stump line, defended on the front foot
nagging line, around off stump, pushed back down the track
banged in short, outside off stump, left alone
Not bad as MacCallum. Blain is off the mark off the 10th delivery. dabbed away to third man
full and outside off stump, beaten while trying to drive
short of length, outside off, cut to point.
picks the slower one, biffs it over cover to the man at the deep
bangs one in short and it sails harmlessly over the batsman who had ducked under. Another dot ball.
on the off stump line, another slower one, worked to midwicket
on the middle and leg stump line, glanced behind square-leg
fullish, on the middle and leg, worked to long leg. Another single.
full, straight, on the off stump line, driven to mid-on
Bouncer. Not good at discotheques, good in cricket.
on the leg stump line, tickled around the corner
on the off stump line, pushed to cover, sets off for a run, gets back. The throw misses the sticks, goes to fine-leg, now Brown wants a single. Blain doesn't. In the end they didn't get a single run.
will get a single this time with a steer to third man
short in length, pulled to midwicket
attempted yorker, just outside off, Brown drives but gets a inside-edge and the ball rolls over behind square-leg
banged in short, rises chest-high, outside off, pushed down to third man
down the leg side
on the stumps, defended on the front foot
this is getting bit boring eh? Another one, full in length, worked to midwicket. But Scotland are trying to their best to last out 50 overs and hence the game is meandering the way it is
Bouncer and he evades that one easily
wide down the leg side.
Another one down the leg side
on the leg and middle, tries to work it to on side, instead gets a leading edge to point
Overpitched on the legs, flicked to deep square-leg
lands outside off, Brown shuffles across and is rapped on the pad. But point of impact well outside off and he will take that leg bye
Overpitched on the off stump, creamed through cover
Overpitched outside off stump, slashed away to third man region
another full-pitched delivery, driven to widish long off
bouncer down the leg side, wide called
Overpitched on the off stump, Brown backs away to crash it through cover
Smash! Half-volley on the off stump line and Blain drills it down the ground.
back away and slices a ful-pitched delivery inside-out over cover. de Villiers make a neat diving stop there.
Brown goes down town. Blistering drive straight down the ground.
Another swing of the bat, the ball scorches the turf enroute to long-off
short of length, on the off stump line, thrashed on the up but straight to cover
swing and a miss. Banged in short - one for the over and Blain shapes to pull but doesn't make contact.
Take that! Blain backs away and murders one over long-off. For a while it looked Pollock would catch it but it just about sails over him.
Suddenly, the floodgates are open. attempted yorker, turns into low full-toss, swung past square-leg
short of length, outside off, dabbed to point . It brings up the fifty of the partnership. Each one got 23 in that.
yorker-length delivery on the middle stump line, Blain  backs away  and brings his bat down in a hurry to keep it ou
Super catch by Kemp. Full-pitched outside off stump and Blain slices it away over cover . Kemp runs in and dives low to his left to take a stunner.
length-delivery outside off, thrashed to sweeper cover
Wow! Upper-cut for six! Hoffman backed away to leg side and cut a length-delivery over backward point, over wide third man for a single. Sliced away for maximum
Tries to repeat the stroke, bat meets air and Boucher gathers
Clatter! Slower one on the middle stump line, Hoffman, again backs away, and heaves it over to deep midwicket
Three boundaries in a row! Jumps out to drill a length-delivery to long-on. Hoffman is having a ball out there.
full and outside off stump, sliced away to third man
Hoffman backs away, Hall rushes one through the outside-off channel and Hoffman can't reach it. He had moved too far to the leg side.

Hoffman is having a party. This is Scotland's highest score, beating 181 for 7 against Australia in 1999,  in World Cup cricket. Full in length, throws his arm at it, gets a outside edge and it screams to third man boundary
again he backs away to the legside, again Hall hurls it full and outside off, Hoffman just stands and watches it go into Boucher's gloves

Hoffman moves away to leg side again, another swing and a miss but Brown has rushed across for a single. Hoffman responds. Meanwhile Boucher throws the ball to Hall who has a shy at the non-striker's ends, misess and they come back for another run

Quite similar to the previous delivery. Well there was a difference. Hall had a direct hit and Hoffman is run out. But a what neat little cameo from him. Lovely hit and giggle effort and Scotland have ended up with their highest WC score.

inn2.comm: Full length ball, almost a loosener. Smith drives it to mid-on. Doesn't time it well though
Length delivery, defended to midwicket
CRACK! Smith sets the ball rolling with a crisp straight drive past the bowler. Ball races away for a four.
Full swinging delivery. Smith goes for the drive again but ball gets the outside edge of the bat. Slightly nervy there
Another loose delivery. Full on leg and Smith simply flicks it with ease through square for another boundary. This is turning out to be an expensive over
Left alone outside off. Best delivery of the lot. He needs to hit that length more often
Blain to share the new ball. Back of a length delivery, AB de Villiers defends to square leg for a single
Outside off and Smith pats it to the off side.
Slightly short and Smith simply rocks back and steers it to third man for a quick single. These two run very well between the wickets.
Wide of off stump, de Villiers goes after it but can't find the gap. Straight to cover.
Full length ball outside off. de Villiers drives it straight back to the bowler
CLATTER! Short ball and de Villiers latches on this time. Creams a pull shot in front of square for a forceful four.
Better length from Hoffmann this time. Back of a length and Smith pushes it firmly to mid-off

That was close. Smith pushes it to mid-off and takes off and that could have been a dangerous run had the fielder picked it up cleanly. He missed the ball, though, and the batsmen complete the run easily.
Defended watchfully to the on side. Hoffmann keeping it tight now.
Full ball, angling in from off to middle. de Villiers caresses it superbly in front of square and it's timed well enough to reach the boundary. No fuss that time. Easily done
Left alone outside off
Pushed firmly to the covers. Straight to the fielder
BANG! Blain pushes it full and wide of the stumps. Bread and butter for Smith who simply laces it through the covers. Brutal shot that and Smith makes it simple.
Padded it away to the off side
Short and on middle and leg. Smith has all the time to pull it behind square for a couple
TAKE THAT! You can't bowl full and on Smith's pads. He's going to brutal with it and bludgeons it through midwicket for another four
Tapped away to square for a single
Driven easily wide of mid-off for another single. Too easy for South Africa at the moment.
Drives to mid-on
Short and outside off, de Villiers simply crashes a square cut for another four
Driven through mid-off for a superb four. de Villiers in the mood here
Steered to third man for a single
Pulled savagely by de Villiers but he can't get the timing right. Ball loops away wide of mid-on and falls short of Ryan Watson
SAVAGE! Cut past backward point for a brutal four. Smith can hit them real hard. He's not going to let short and wide balls go away untouched
Similar ball and Smith goes for a similar cut. But straight to backward point
Straight ball, back of a length, flicked to mid-on. Smith middling them well now
Whipped away to fine leg for a single
In the channel outside off stump, slower one, Smith is through with his cut shot early and the ball beats him and bounces just in front of the 'keeper and breaks away
again short, again de Villiers was almost through with his shot - ends up swatting it away past square-leg
Banged in short and Smith whacks it over midwicket. Thuds into the advertising hoards.
on the middle peg, on a length, Smith goes back, works it to deep square-leg
gentle seam-up stuff on the middle and off, turned to midwicket
full in length, on the middle stump line, lapped behind square-leg
classy. Short of length, just outside off, Smith plays it late and cuts past backward point. Don't bowl there boss. He will make you bleed.
full and straight, on the middle and leg, muscles it away through midwicket.
on the middle and leg, straightens a touch, Smith tries to wrist it away, gets a leading edge to cover
The slog goes awry. He charged down the track, backing away to legside in the process and goes for a whack at a length-delivery on the off side. Gets an inside-edge to short fine-leg
Ryan Watson drops a tough chance. Short of length, on the off side, Smith cuts and it flies to right of gully where Watson stretches his right hand out but can't hold on
full and on the middle and off stump line, pushed to cover. The 'keeper is standing up.
backs away, exposing the stumps, but the ball follows him and he swivels to pull it to deep square-leg
on a length, around off, played to midwicket
back of length, on the off stump line, de Villiers eases back, punches it to point
short in length, de Villiers is a good puller. Short-arm jabs it over midwicket.
back of length, just outside off, punched on the up to short cover where a tumbling stop is made
full, on the off and middle stump line, driven back to the bowler.
Again Smith backs away, Brown digs in at him and is pulled behind square-leg
another move to the legside, this time Brown hurls it full and is thrashed down the ground.
slower ball, on the middle and leg stump, Smith checks his shot, pushes it back to Brown
on the middle and leg, fisted away through midwicket
full in length, on the off stump, pushed to left of mid-on for a single.
The fours keep coming. Short in length, just outside off stump, not much room actually but not much pace as well and that allows de Villiers to rock back and punch it past point
dot ball. Whoa! Full in length, pushed back to the bowler
length-delivery, just outside off stump, hit on the up, to mid-off and they rush across for a quick single
Gets to his fifty with a flick-shot through the square-leg region. Low full-toss on the leg and gift-wraps a boundary.,
full in length, on the legs, turned down to fine leg
up and over mid-off. Slightly short of length, a tad outside off and de Villiers punches it on the up. Into to the no-man's land.
on the middle and leg, full in length, fisted away to the right of mid-on.
slower one, fullish, on the off stump line, driven back to the bowler
another slower one. Outside off, pushed to the off side
Scotland continued to bleed.  Length-delivery on the middle stump line and he short-arm jabs it over midwicket. Very skilfful stroke.
Change of pace from the bowler. de Villiers imparts velocity to it with a thrash-drive down the ground.
from round the wickets, floated on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side. The slog-sweep will come out soon.
tossed up, full in length, on the middle and leg stump line and is worked to deep midwicket to bring up the 100
floated outside off, Smith comes down the track, fetches it from there and drills it to long-on
flighted delivery outside off, driven to long-off
flatter, on the off stump line, driven inside-out to deep cover
cute. Floated outside off stump, full in length, de Villers waits, goes back and across, opens the bat-face and late cuts. Runs it through the vacant slip region, past the short-third man fielder.
lands on the middle, turns in, dabbed to the on side
flatter and on the off stump line, punched towards mid-off, the bowler rushes across dives and misses but the cover fielder gets across and makes the stop
turns in from off, nudged past square-leg
from round the wickets. floats it in, driven back to the bowler
on the middle and leg stump line, nibbled away past midwicket
flatter, slightly short in length, outside off, cut past point
There comes the slog-sweep. Low full-toss on the middle stump line, swung away
on the leg side, swept away fine. Very fine.
flighted delivery on the off stump line, driven to long-off
sharp turn, breaks in, de Villers is beaten in the flight and then by the turn.
Now de Villers brings up his fifty. First in the WC. On the middle stump line, nudged through midwicket
slightly short in length, cut to point
again slightly short, cut to deep point
First six of the SA innings but what a brutal stroke. Slightly short in length, on the off and middle, AB rocks back and pulls it over long-on
charges out this time and sends it soaring over long-on
leans forward and defends
Couldn't resist the urge to hit out. Sends a fullish delivery straight down the throat of long-on.
on the middle stump line, worked to square-leg
on the middle stump line, driven to long-on
lands on the off stump line, pushed to cover
on the middle stump line, turned past square-leg
tossed up on the off and middle, driven to long-off
on the off and middle, driven inside-out to cover
slow through the air, on the middle stump line, driven to cover
on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
outside off, not much turn, Smith leans forward, guides it to backward point
on the middle stump line, turned straight to midwicket
waltzes down the track and swings it over midwicket.
on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket
attempts a reverse-sweep and it bounds off the edge to the off side.
on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side
from round the wickets, floats it on, Prince goes for a sweep and is struck on the pad. Hit him outside off.
flighted delivery, Prince is down the track and drives to long-off
another drive to long-off.
pushed to cover.
Prince tries another reverse-sweep. Successful this time. Gets two.
tossed up on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
short, flat and well outside off. Blame the rain. It is difficult to grip the delivery. Prince helps himself with a boundary. Cut past point
on the off stump line, turns in, driven to mid-off.
And again.
on the legs, Prince retains the strike with a flicked-drive to long leg
drifting on the legs, pushed to midwicket
Another reverse-sweep. Will get four this time.
Low full toss on the off stump line, driven over cover. The substitue fielder, Lyons,  gets around from the sweeper position, dives to make a good stop
will get a single with a nudge to square-leg. Smith will face his first ball after resumption of play
leans forward, taps a ball to cover point for a single
Punched straight to extra cover. Short in length, and outside off, fisted straight to MacCallum.
loopy delivery on the legs, tickled around the corner for a quick single
loopy delivery on the legs, tickled around the corner
Leans forward and knifes through the line and over mid-off
comes down the track and heaves it to long-on
on the middle stump line, driven to midwicket
low full-toss, slips down the leg side.
outside off, turned to slip
floats it on the leg and middle, turned to fine-leg
0n the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
flat and on the middle peg, turned to the right of midwicket
Moves to 91 with a towering six over long-on. Down the track and hits it on to the roof. Big hit!
comes down the track, pushed that one through quicker and he just taps it to on side
Gone! Smith tries to biff a delivery to the on side but can't clear Rogers at midwicket. His 91 came in 65 balls. Not bad eh?
tossed-up on the off and middle, driven past mid-on.  A mere push and it races away. 5 more needed.
Out of the ground! Kemp finishes things off in style. Waltzes down the track and biffs a fullish delivery over long-on. Over the few spectators, over the roof and onto the street.
